messages.message: Perspective is that BAML has a global IT and Operations budget of $16billion dollars. We are the 1/10000 important item on that list but for the executives and people involved we are priority #3 (they care about their day job, what they currently have to manage, then us) so how do we float across ideas and terms that hit home. So please spend time to re-interpret that list
I won't say scalability or reliably process.
Yeah â€” wondering how we would phrase it differently
was trying to work `high throughput` v/s `reliability`.  Both have similar connotations
From a customer's point of view, reliability is assumed. When we convey high throughput, they will assume that reliability is implicit; will come out of the box.
sorry should have said `high througput` v/s `scalability`
I agree on the implicit part of reliability
also keeping the concept as simple as possible with positive intent. I am giving you this new amazing feature you didnt expect. In this case I am giving you throughput? Scalability? reliability? etc
